attributes.action: BORIS JOHNSON TO CALL FOR A NATIONAL DAY OF PRAYER IN REGARDS TO COVID-19
attributes.additional_details:
Our Prime Minister Boris Johnson is known to be an evangelical Christian. He is very  supportive of faith groups and Christian organisations.

Irrespective of ones  religious views, the fact is that every day Parliament begins prayers, for Her Majesty and indeed for all politicians, that they should govern justly. 

I would like our Prime minister to set a National day of prayer in regards to the Coronavirus  (COVID-19) pandemic,  for God to intervene & heal our nation.
attributes.background:
Our Prime Minister is an evangelical Christian. He once described his faith in exactly the same way as many of us may be feeling in light of  COVID-19.

"I mean sometimes the signal is strong, and then sometimes I'm afraid it just vanishes. And then it comes back again."

rejection.details:
This would be a matter for religious institutions, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307364

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

We only reject petitions that don’t meet the petition standards.
